data.title: Art Carney Biography
data.meta_description: Read all about Art Carney with TV Guide's exclusive biography including their list of awards, celeb facts and more at TV Guide.
data.text:
Fast Facts

Did myriad impersonations as a child, including Jimmy Durante, Edward G

Robinson and Franklin D

Roosevelt, and won talent contests in elementary school and high school

Entered the U

S

Army in the early 1940s and endured a serious leg wound at Normandy, which left him with a permanent limp

Never took an acting course

Before landing the role of Ed Norton on The Honeymooners, played second banana on radio to Fred Allen, Edgar Bergen and Bert Lahr in the late '40s

Created the role of Felix Unger (opposite Walter Matthau) in the original 1965 Broadway production of The Odd Couple

Made his final big-screen appearance in the 1993 Arnold Schwarzenegger vehicle Last Action Hero

Son Brian plays the GEICO gecko's boss in a series of commercials for the insurance company

Star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame is located at 6627 Hollywood Boulevard

Awards

1990Emmy-Outstanding Lead Actor in a Miniseries or Special: nominated

1984Emmy-Outstanding Supporting Actor in a Limited Series or Special: winner

1976Emmy-Outstanding Single Performance by a Supporting Actor in Comedy or Drama Special: nominated

1975Golden Globe-Best Performance by an Actor in a Motion Picture - Musical or Comedy: winner

1974Oscar-Best Performance by an Actor in a Leading Role: winner

1968Emmy-Special Classifications of Individual Achievements: winner

1967Emmy-Special Classifications of Individual Achievements: winner

1966Emmy-Special Classifications of Individual Achievements: nominated

1957Emmy-Best Supporting Performance by an Actor: nominated

1956Emmy-Best Actor in a Supporting Role: winner

1955Emmy-Best Supporting Actor in a Regular Series: winner

1954Emmy-Best Series Supporting Actor: winner
